excerpt: Colonia del Sacramento is a city in southwestern Uruguay, across the Río de La Plata from Buenos Aires. It's known for its cobblestoned Barrio Histórico, lined with buildings from its time as a Portuguese settlement. Set above the historic district is the 19th-century Colonia del Sacramento Lighthouse, offering sweeping river views. Nearby lies the Portón de Campo, remnants from the old city walls.
detail_description: Colonia del Sacramento is a charming city in southwestern Uruguay, situated across the Río de La Plata from Buenos Aires. Its cobblestoned Barrio Histórico showcases historic Portuguese buildings, while the 19th-century Colonia del Sacramento Lighthouse offers stunning river views. The city's recent international acclaim and UNESCO World Heritage Site recognition have led to impressive growth as a tourist destination and a booming real estate market.
name: Colonia del Sacramento
address: 70000 Colonia Department, Uruguay

excerpt: A World Heritage Site, this stone-paved street offers colorful edifices & storied tales of its past.
detail_description: Calle de los Suspiros, also known as the Street of Sighs, is a charming stone-paved street located in a World Heritage Site. The area is filled with colorful buildings and rich historical tales. Visitors can explore the Plaza Mayor and its unique monuments such as the City Gate with an impressive drawbridge, the 1857 Lighthouse, and the oldest church in Uruguay, Iglesia Matriz. The post-colonial architecture of the city is beautifully illustrated by this church.
name: Calle de los Suspiros
address: 70000 Colonia del Sacramento, Departamento de Colonia, Uruguay

excerpt: Colonial landmarks and cobblestone streets abound in Barrio Histórico, a UNESCO-listed historic district on the Rio de la Plata that combines Spanish, Portuguese and post-colonial urban design. Portón de Campo is an old city gate with a drawbridge, while a lighthouse among the ruins of a 17th-century convent offers views of the waterfront neighborhood. Serene Barrio Histórico also has museums, hotels and eateries.
detail_description: Barrio Histórico is a UNESCO-listed historic district located on the Rio de la Plata, featuring colonial landmarks and cobblestone streets that showcase a blend of Spanish, Portuguese, and post-colonial urban design. The area includes the Portón de Campo, an old city gate with a drawbridge, as well as a lighthouse amidst the ruins of a 17th-century convent offering scenic views of the waterfront neighborhood.
name: Barrio Histórico
address: Colonia del Sacramento, Colonia Department, Uruguay

excerpt: Grand, historic Catholic church with soaring, arched ceilings, statuary & antique pews.
detail_description: Nestled in the charming town of Colonia del Sacramento, the Basilica of the Blessed Sacrament stands as a testament to history and architectural beauty. This grand Catholic church, built by Portuguese settlers between 1808 and 1810, features impressive arched ceilings and antique pews that transport visitors back in time. Despite facing challenges like an explosion in 1823 that necessitated significant renovations, it has preserved its original one-nave design through careful restorations over the years.
name: Basilica of the Blessed Sacrament
address: G4HX+HM3, 70000 Col. del Sacramento, Departamento de Colonia, Uruguay

detail_description: Plaza Mayor, once a vibrant center of town, now attracts leisurely tourists. The area is dotted with private residences and features the informative Mueso Portugues, providing insights into the town's history. Visitors can stroll along cobbled streets leading to the sea, experiencing a blend of historical charm and modern relaxation.
name: Plaza Mayor
address: 70000 Colonia del Sacramento, Departamento de Colonia, Uruguay

detail_description: Puerta de la Ciudadela, also known as Puerta de Campo, is a significant feature in the Historic District. This ancient door was constructed in 1745 under the governance of the Portuguese. It is part of the old wall and holds great historical importance for the area.
name: Puerta de la ciudadela
address: Manuel de Lobo 242, 70000 Col. del Sacramento, Departamento de Colonia, Uruguay

excerpt: Portuguese colonial artifacts & furniture displayed inside an 18th-century adobe & stone home.
detail_description: Espacio Portugués, Museo de Colonia is a museum housed in an 18th-century Portuguese home, showcasing colonial artifacts and furniture. It is located near other museums and historical sites in the Plaza Mayor area. The exhibits include Portuguese habits, history, instruments, uniforms, and the battles between the Portuguese and Spanish crowns during colonial times. Visitors can explore different periods of home interiors at this museum as well as learn about the town's history through scale models from the Portuguese period.
name: Espacio Portugués - Museo de Colonia
address: Enriquez de la Peña 180, entre calle De Solís (frente a la Plaza Mayor, 25 de mayo)entre, Calle de los Suspiros, 70000 Col. del Sacramento, Uruguay

excerpt: Minimalist quarters in a serene riverside hotel offering a modern restaurant & an outdoor bar.
detail_description: Charco Bistró is a modern restaurant located in a serene riverside hotel, offering minimalist quarters and an outdoor bar. The bistro provides a range of dishes such as tenderloin steak, rack of lamb, grilled salmon, veggie-filled raviolis, and even poke. With its kids menu and outdoor seating with views of the water, it's an ideal place for families to enjoy a leisurely afternoon on the terrace.
name: Charco bistró
address: G4GX+P5H, Misiones de los Tapes, 70000 Col. del Sacramento, Departamento de Colonia, Uruguay

excerpt: Lighthouse dating to the 1850s, with a staircase to the top & historical displays.
detail_description: Colonia del Sacramento Lighthouse, dating back to the 1850s, offers a historical journey with its staircase leading to the top and displays showcasing its past. The city's Plaza Mayor features various unique monuments such as the City Gate with an impressive drawbridge, the Street of Sighs offering a view of the sea, and the oldest church in Uruguay - Iglesia Matriz. Visitors are encouraged to allocate at least 4-5 hours to explore this charming city before catching their ferry.
name: Colonia del Sacramento Lighthouse
address: G4GX+V38, De San Francisco, 70000 Col. del Sacramento, Departamento de Colonia, Uruguay

detail_description: Centro Cultural Bastión del Carmen is a historic site in Colonia del Sacramento, Uruguay, with a rich and mysterious past. Legends abound about the street it's located on, from being a place for prisoners to drown to seafarers seeking entertainment. The center itself is housed in a building that was once a soap factory and later became property of Argentinians before being transformed into a cultural hub by the Ministry of Culture.
name: Centro Cultural Bastión del Carmen
address: G4JX+CVC, Rivadavia 223, 70000 Col. del Sacramento, Departamento de Colonia, Uruguay

detail_description: Nestled along the picturesque banks of the Rio de la Plata, the Bastión de San Pedro is a captivating historical site in Colonia del Sacramento that offers visitors a glimpse into the past. This charming bastion not only commemorates significant events from 1762, including military conflicts involving Spain and Portugal, but also serves as an ideal spot to soak in breathtaking sunsets. With its stunning river views and iconic large Uruguayan flag, it’s a must-visit for anyone exploring this quaint city.
name: Bastión de San Pedro
address: G4GW+QFP, Paseo Gabriel y De San, De San Pedro, Col. del Sacramento, Departamento de Colonia, Uruguay

detail_description: Real de San Carlos is home to the iconic letters of Colonia, situated along Rambla de las Americas. It's a leisurely 30-minute stroll from the city center to reach this popular spot.
name: Real de San Carlos
address: Colonia del Sacramento, Colonia Department, Uruguay

name: Colonia del Sacramento
address: 70000 Departamento de Colonia, Uruguay

detail_description: Gallery of Sighs, also known as La Calle de los Suspiros, is a historic street in Uruguay that dates back to the city's founding in 1680. It is famous for its picturesque views and mysterious stories, with some legends suggesting that it was named after the sighs of prisoners awaiting their fate. The street features colonial-style buildings and cobblestone roads, making it a popular spot for photographers.
name: Gallery of Sighs
address: G4GX+QHC, Calle de los Suspiros, 70000 Col. del Sacramento, Departamento de Colonia, Uruguay

excerpt: 18th-century structure housing exhibits documenting the community from prehistoric to modern times.
detail_description: The Municipal Museum is located in an 18th-century stone building, originally constructed in 1795 and rebuilt by the Spanish in 1835. It offers a comprehensive look at the community's history from prehistoric to modern times. The exhibits cover various aspects such as local wars between the Portuguese and Spanish, archaeological findings, geological displays, religious artifacts, and cultural items.
name: Municipal Museum
address: Comercio 77, 70000 Col. del Sacramento, Departamento de Colonia, Uruguay

detail_description: Ruins of the Convent of San Francisco, located near the Colonia del Sacramento Lighthouse, date back to around 1690 and were left in ruins after a fire in 1704. The remaining walls offer a glimpse into the construction using rocks from that era. Adjacent to the lighthouse, these ruins provide an imposing sight with their thick walls and historical significance. Visitors can appreciate the historic stone construction and capture some impressive photographs.
name: Ruinas del Convento de San Francisco
address: G4GX+W4C, 70000 Col. del Sacramento, Departamento de Colonia, Uruguay

excerpt: Musuem with a global collection of over 5,000 tiles, plus painting, sculpture & ceramic exhibits.
detail_description: The Museo Del Azulejo, located at the corner of Misiones de los Tapes and Paseo de San Gabriel, is a small 17th-century stone house that houses a diverse collection of over 5,000 tiles from around the world. In addition to its impressive array of French and Catalan tiles, the museum also features painting, sculpture, and ceramic exhibits.
name: Museo Del Azulejo
address: Misiones de los Tapes 104, 70000 Col. del Sacramento, Departamento de Colonia, Uruguay

detail_description: Plaza de Armas, the main square in Colonia del Sacramento, is a charming area located at the heart of the historical district. The square features Iglesia Matriz, the oldest church in Uruguay, which was built by the Portuguese in 1680 and later renovated by the Spanish. The stunning white exterior of this grand Catholic Church Basilica del Santisimo Sacramento makes it a must-see attraction.
name: Plaza de Armas
address: G4HX+CMJ, 70000 Col. del Sacramento, Departamento de Colonia, Uruguay

detail_description: Cerveceria Barbot in Colonia del Sacramento is a charming brew pub that offers an inviting atmosphere perfect for beer enthusiasts and food lovers alike. Known for its excellent selection of craft beers, including a unique pumpkin brew, this cozy spot also serves delicious homemade dishes like their renowned pâté. The ambiance is enhanced by beautiful artwork adorning the walls, creating a delightful backdrop for your visit.
name: Cerveceria Barbot
address: Washington Barbot 160, 70000 Col. del Sacramento, Departamento de Colonia, Uruguay

detail_description: Colonia Sign is a popular tourist spot in Colonia de Sacramento, Uruguay. The large colorful letters overlooking the beach provide a perfect backdrop for photos against the glistening waters and shining sun. Visitors can enjoy walking along the coast, watching people play volleyball, sipping mate, and taking a dip in the water. Accessible by off-road parking nearby, it offers flat and level ground suitable for strollers or wheelchairs.
name: Colonia Sign
address: H44R+54X, Rbla. de las Amèricas, 70000 Col. del Sacramento, Departamento de Colonia, Uruguay

detail_description: Motel Plaza de Toros is a historic bull ring located about 5 km from Colonia city center. Built in 1910, it holds the distinction of being a National Historic Landmark. While bull fights were once held here for a brief period, they have since been banned. The site has now been repurposed into a shopping center, offering visitors an enjoyable and romantic ambiance with its spacious layout.
name: Motel Plaza de Toros
address: 7 338, 70000, Col. del Sacramento, Departamento de Colonia, Uruguay

detail_description: When exploring the charming Old Town of Colonia Del Sacramento, a visit to Luggage Storage Colonia Del Sacramento Old Town - Radical Storage is a must for travelers looking to lighten their load. This historic area, with its cobblestone streets and beautifully aged buildings, offers an enchanting glimpse into the past. As you wander through this 300-year-old neighborhood, you'll encounter quaint bars where local men share stories and admire the intricate wooden doors that adorn many structures.
name: Luggage Storage Colonia Del Sacramento Old Town - Radical Storage
address: Ituzaingó 166, 70000 Col. del Sacramento, Departamento de Colonia, Uruguay

excerpt: Sizable, historic fort in a waterfront setting featuring cannons & scenic views.
detail_description: San Miguel Bastion is a historic fort located in a picturesque waterfront setting. It features cannons and offers scenic views of the Rio de la Plata, the body of water between Argentina and Uruguay. The bastion includes the Puerta de la Ciudadela, an ancient gate, and ruins of the lighthouse, making it one of Colonia Del Sacramento's original stone structures. Visitors can explore remnants of old city walls and former city gates while taking in the charming historical ambiance.
name: San Miguel Bastion
address: G4GX+JMP, De San Pedro, 70000 Col. del Sacramento, Departamento de Colonia, Uruguay

detail_description: The Bastion de Santa Rita is an adorable area featuring a charming riverside promenade and numerous tourist-oriented dining establishments. However, it would be remiss not to mention that one's lunch experience may vary. Notably, the desired parrilla was unfortunately closed, resulting in settling for one of the more popular spots catering to tourists. This picturesque location boasts abundant greenery, rich historical sites, and breathtaking views of the river.
name: Bastión de Santa Rita
address: G4HW+VM4, y, Paseo de San Gabriel & Calle de Sta. Rita, Col. del Sacramento, Departamento de Colonia, Uruguay

excerpt: Compact museum with a small, varied collection of fossils, shells & other archaeological finds.
detail_description: Espacio Paleontológico, Museo de Colonia is a compact museum featuring a diverse collection of fossils, shells, and archaeological artifacts. The Museo Indigena showcases stone tools from the Charrua people, while the Museo Paleontologico exhibits glyptodon shells and other locally excavated finds. Visitors can learn about South American megafauna and marine life in this small but informative museum. Additionally, guests appreciate the friendly assistance provided by the staff.
name: Espacio Paleontológico - Museo de Colonia
address: Jose Roger Balet 181, 70000 Col. del Sacramento, Departamento de Colonia, Uruguay

detail_description: Nestled in the charming Old Town of Colonia del Sacramento, La Bodeguita is a delightful restaurant that boasts stunning views of the Rio de la Plata. This popular spot attracts both tourists and locals alike with its extensive menu featuring an array of pizzas, salads, pastas, meats, refreshing drinks, and delectable desserts. The inviting atmosphere makes it an ideal place to unwind while savoring traditional Uruguayan cuisine.
name: La Bodeguita
address: 70000 Col. del Sacramento, Departamento de Colonia, Uruguay

excerpt: Sunset views are showcased at this peaceful locale offering a small sand beach & nearby cafe.
detail_description: Playa urbana El Alamo is a serene spot with stunning sunset views and a small sandy beach. It's just a short walk from Colonia's historic quarter and offers security, ample parking, and a beachside restaurant. While there are no lifeguards or beach chair rentals, it's the perfect place to bring your own towel and unwind. For a peaceful experience, consider cycling along the riverbank to soak in the tranquility of this charming town.
name: Playa urbana El Alamo
address: Colonia Department, Uruguay

detail_description: Espacio Español, Museo de Colonia is a must-visit museum in Colonia that offers insights into the history of the place and the battles between Spain and Portugal for the enclave. The museum features various rooms with a wealth of information, videos, and exhibits showcasing the city's evolution from its early days to the present era. While some visitors feel that there could be more detailed explanations for the displayed objects and multilingual support, it remains a worthwhile visit.
name: Espacio Español, Museo de Colonia
address: G4JX+29P, De San Jose, 70000 Col. del Sacramento, Departamento de Colonia, Uruguay

detail_description: The Gastropub Chopería Mastra offers craft beer drinkers a diverse range of beers to try, as well as tasty chivitos (sausages). The place has a rustic atmosphere and is perfect for relaxing after a long day.
name: La Chopería Colonia
address: Comercio 158, 70000 Col. del Sacramento, Departamento de Colonia, Uruguay

detail_description: Nestled in the charming Old Town of Colonia del Sacramento, Bohemia Bistro is a must-visit for anyone who adores Italian cuisine. This delightful eatery welcomes guests daily for lunch and opens its doors for dinner on Fridays and Saturdays. The inviting atmosphere allows diners to enjoy their meals while soaking in stunning views of the Rio de la Plata, making it an ideal spot to relax and savor delicious dishes.
name: Bohemia Bistro
address: De San Pedro 142, 70000 Col. del Sacramento, Departamento de Colonia, Uruguay

excerpt: Unassuming rooms in a laid-back hotel featuring river views, an outdoor pool & a cozy guest lounge.
detail_description: Posada Boutique Las Terrazas is a charming hotel located just 100 meters from Colonias historical circuit. The property offers a relaxed atmosphere with unassuming rooms that feature river views, iPod docking stations, and flat-screen cable TVs. Guests can enjoy the outdoor swimming pool and make use of the free Wi-Fi and netbooks provided in this solar-powered environment.
name: Posada Boutique Las Terrazas
address: Manuel de Lobo 281, 70000 Col. del Sacramento, Departamento de Colonia, Uruguay

detail_description: Colonia Del Sacramento Boulevard, also known as Rambla, is a picturesque waterfront promenade offering breathtaking views. It's perfect for leisurely walks during the day and becomes an ideal spot to witness stunning sunsets. The well-maintained sidewalk is wide and safe, with street lights illuminating the path at night. The area boasts numerous restaurants within walking distance of the UNESCO protected old city, making it family-friendly.
name: Colonia Del Sacramento Boulevard
address: Avenida Artigas 459, 70000 Col. del Sacramento, Departamento de Colonia, Uruguay

detail_description: Plaza Mayor 25 de Mayo is the heart of the neighborhood, offering a serene atmosphere and surrounded by historic sites. The Barrio Historico comes alive with its vibrant arts scene and local festivals, while museums like Museo Portugues and Museo Municipal provide deeper insights into its storied past. Visitors can enjoy sitting in the shade of trees, browsing shops, and experiencing the colorful vibes during both day and night.
name: Plaza Mayor
address: G4HX+397, 70000 Col. del Sacramento, Departamento de Colonia, Uruguay

detail_description: Granja Arenas is an outstanding establishment known for its exceptional service and professional, amiable staff. It is a family-friendly venue that offers free admission and follows strict Covid protocols to ensure visitors' safety. The museum showcases a fascinating collection of Guinness World Record awarded exhibits, providing an enriching experience to all who visit.
name: Granja Colonia
address: Ruta 1, Kmto. 167, 70000 Departamento de Colonia, Uruguay

detail_description: Colonia del Sacramento Aquarium is a small but enjoyable attraction located near the historic center of Colonia del Sacramento. It features native fish and is open every day except Tuesdays, from 2 pm to 6 pm. While some visitors found the aquarium to be small and mentioned cleanliness issues, others enjoyed the experience of observing the native fish species. The entrance fee is 100 pesos, making it an affordable activity for those interested in marine life.
name: Colonia del Sacramento Aquarium
address: Virrey Ceballos, 70000 Col. del Sacramento, Departamento de Colonia, Uruguay

detail_description: Discover Playa Ferrando, a picturesque beach located in a small bay just a short scooter ride from the city center. You can easily find your way there with a map from Thrifty Rentals, which also highlights other attractions in and around Colonia. Whether you visit in summer, spring, fall or winter, this beach offers the perfect setting to soak up the sun or take leisurely strolls. Buses are available for convenient access to this lovely spot.
name: Playa Ferrando
address: Colonia Department, Uruguay

detail_description: The Museum Parque Anchorena Vista Aerea is a place rich in history, displaying a remarkable level of devotion to every detail. The guide accompanying visitors during the tour is highly knowledgeable and professional. This excellent location offers a captivating experience through its beautiful surroundings. The museum showcases an abundance of historical significance within the area, ensuring visitors receive a comprehensive understanding.
name: Parque Anchorena
address: P2F7+FVH, 70000 Col. del Sacramento, Departamento de Colonia, Uruguay

excerpt: Built in the 18th century, this rustic house-turned-museum features historic furniture & objects.
detail_description: Nacarello House is a charming museum housed in an 18th-century rustic home that offers a glimpse into the early days of Colonia. The house features historic furniture and objects, with thick whitewashed walls, wavy glass, and original lintels adding to its authentic ambiance. Visitors are transported back in time as they explore the well-preserved rooms, including the kitchen with its black soot walls and period-specific furnishings.
name: Nacarello House
address: Comercio 67, 70000 Col. del Sacramento, Departamento de Colonia, Uruguay

excerpt: Backed by shady trees & picnic tables, this laid-back, spacious beach offers swimming & sunbathing.
name: Playa urbana Real de San Carlos
address: Colonia Department, Uruguay

detail_description: Embarcadero de Yates Riachuelo Park, situated in Colonia, is undeniably a stunning location that captivates visitors with its natural charm. This enchanting park exudes an undeniable allure and is adored by many for its captivating beauty. The serene ambiance of this lovely place entices countless individuals who seek solace amidst nature's perfection.
name: Embarcadero de Yates Riachuelo Park
address: H74C+4XJ, Don Ventura Casal, 70000 Riachuelo, Departamento de Colonia, Uruguay

excerpt: Small museum in an 18th-century Portuguese house  featuring exhibits related to Colonia's history.
detail_description: Museo y Archivo Regional is a small museum housed in an 18th-century Portuguese building, showcasing exhibits that delve into the history of Colonia. Located on the northwest edge of Plaza Mayor 25 de Mayo, it also houses historical documents and artifacts such as pottery and glass excavated from the nearby Casa de los Gobernadores. Visitors can explore a wealth of information about the colony, including audio recordings and firsthand accounts from local residents.
name: Museo y Archivo Regional
address: Misiones de los Tapes 115, 70000 Col. del Sacramento, Departamento de Colonia, Uruguay

detail_description: The Museo del Humor Interactivo is a delightful gem that invites visitors to explore the multifaceted world of humor. Housed in a charming old building, this museum features numerous themed rooms filled with interactive content, including games, books, and televisions that engage all ages. The experience is enhanced by an eccentric yet warm-hearted host who adds a unique flair to the visit.
name: Museo del Humor interactivo
address: G4HX+HHV, esquina, Vasconcellos & De Portugal, Col. del Sacramento, Departamento de Colonia, Uruguay

detail_description: Plaza 1811 is a stunning seaside location with a picturesque beach directly facing an impressive wall. The area features benches for relaxation and a tourist service center that provides comprehensive information on all the city's tourist activities. It serves as a perfect spot to unwind while exploring the city, offering breathtaking views both during the day and at night.
name: Plaza 1811
address: G4GX+XXQ, Manuel de Lobo, 70000 Col. del Sacramento, Departamento de Colonia, Uruguay

detail_description: Museo del Origami is a captivating museum that showcases the history and techniques of origami, featuring works by world-renowned masters. The museum's love for origami is evident in its comprehensive exploration of the art form, including its pedagogical and scientific applications. Visitors can admire impressive original pieces from around the globe while receiving friendly and informative explanations from the owner.
name: Museo del Origami
address: Ituzaingó 131, 70000 Col. del Sacramento, Departamento de Colonia, Uruguay

name: Museo Naval
address: Henriquez de la Peña 168, 70000 Col. del Sacramento, Departamento de Colonia, Uruguay

excerpt: Reconstructed ruins of a historical Portuguese house featuring stone walls, floors & doorways.
detail_description: Casa del Virrey is a reconstructed historical Portuguese house with stone walls, floors, and doorways. It is located near the Plaza Mayor and offers pedestrian routes with signs indicating outstanding constructions such as Bastion del Carmen, Calle de los Suspiros, La Puerta de la Ciudadela, and La Iglesia Matriz. Surrounding the area are shopping malls, street stalls offering souvenirs and local food stalls.
name: Casa del Virrey
address: G4HX+42F, Misiones de los Tapes, 70000 Col. del Sacramento, Departamento de Colonia, Uruguay

detail_description: We had the opportunity to visit Viñedos y Olivares del Quintón, a winery that provided us with an exceptional experience. Our group enjoyed a delicious lunch before embarking on an intriguing tour of the olive oil factory and winery guided by Virginia. The tour was captivating, offering valuable insights into the production process of both olive oil and wine. The attention we received throughout was top-notch, ensuring that our visit was memorable.
name: Viñedos y Olivares Del Quintón
address: 70000 Quinton, Departamento de Colonia, Uruguay

detail_description: Explore the charming streets of the city and you'll come across a fascinating display of old cars. Some are still operational, while others are creatively parked with unique exhibits inside. From a car being driven by a fish outside the aquarium to another adorned with flourishing plants, these vintage vehicles add character to the old town's ambiance. Take a leisurely stroll and immerse yourself in this captivating old cars culture that is scattered throughout the area.
name: Old cars culture
address: De Portugal 199, 70000 Col. del Sacramento, Departamento de Colonia, Uruguay
